greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 1, k >= 1, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) = Sum_{j=1..n} gcd(j, n)^k.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Eulerian Number and Euler's Number Triangle
formula: G.f. of column k: Sum_{i>=1} phi(i) * ( Sum_{j=1..k} A008292(k, j) * x^(i*j) )/(1 - x^i)^(k+1).
Dirichlet g.f. of column k: zeta(s-1) * zeta(s-k) / zeta(s). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 18 2021
example: G.f. of column 3: Sum_{i>=1} phi(i) * (x^i + 4*x^(2*i) + x^(3*i))/(1 - x^i)^4.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := DivisorSum[n, EulerPhi[n/#] * #^k &]; Table[T[k, n - k + 1], {n, 1, 11}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 18 2021 *)
program: (PARI) T(n, k) = sum(j=1, n, gcd(j, n)^k);
(PARI) T(n, k) = sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*d*sigma(d, k-1));
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Apr 17 2021
